properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Under partly cloudy skies, patchy frost is expected tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-17T13:28:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-16T21:29:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1996235369.2019

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Early-season snow for part of the Alaska highway. An unseasonably cold Arctic airmass will descend upon Yukon and northern BC beginning Saturday. Rain near the Yukon-B.C. border will likely become mixed with snow beginning Saturday evening as temperatures approach the freezing mark. The potential for wet snow will persist until midday Monday. Snowfall accumulations are possible, particularly along the highest sections of the Alaska highway between Fort Nelson and Watson Lake including near Summit Pass. The highest likelihood of accumulating snow will be overnight Saturday into Sunday morning when road surface temperatures approach zero degrees Celsius. Temperatures will return to seasonal values beginning on Tuesday. Motorists should be prepared for the potential of snow and slippery road conditions and are encouraged to check road conditions on DriveBC and www.511yukon.ca before heading out. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-17T13:00:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-17T05:01:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3073604162.2019
Area: Muncho Lake Park - Stone Mountain Park

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. A low pressure system continues to bring heavy rain to parts of northeastern Alberta and northwestern Saskatchewan. In total, rainfall amounts of 40 to 60 mm are expected, with locally higher amounts up to 90 mm possible. This system will exit the province of Alberta by Saturday morning, bringing an end to the rain. Periods of rain are expected to linger across northern Saskatchewan until Sunday morning. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-17T13:27:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-16T21:28:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3733753267.2019
